query.name: auth.teams.list
query.desc: Obtain a full list of workspaces your org-wide app has been approved for.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: cursor
input.description: Set cursor to next_cursor returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

input.name: include_icon
input.description: Whether to return icon paths for each workspace. An icon path represents a URI pointing to the image signifying the workspace.

input.name: limit
input.description: The maximum number of workspaces to return. Must be a positive integer no larger than 1000.

input.name: external_unique_id

input.name: join_url

input.name: created_by
input.description: The valid Slack user ID of the user who created this Call. When this method is called with a user token, the created_by field is optional and defaults to the authed user of the token. Otherwise, the field is required.

input.name: date_start

input.name: desktop_app_join_url
input.description: When supplied, available Slack clients will attempt to directly launch the 3rd-party Call with this URL.

action.name: chat.deleteScheduledMessage
action.desc: Deletes a pending scheduled message from the queue.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: The channel the scheduled_message is posting to

input.name: scheduled_message_id
input.description: scheduled_message_id returned from call to chat.scheduleMessage

input.name: as_user
input.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with chat:write:user scope. Bot users in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with chat:write:bot scope.

query.name: chat.getPermalink

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: The ID of the conversation or channel containing the message

input.name: message_ts
input.description: A message's ts value, uniquely identifying it within a channel

action.name: chat.meMessage
action.desc: Share a me message into a channel.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

input.name: text
input.description: Text of the message to send.

action.name: chat.postEphemeral
action.desc: Sends an ephemeral message to a user in a channel.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

input.name: user
input.description: id of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. The user should be in the channel specified by the channel argument.

input.name: attachments
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: blocks
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: text
input.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

input.name: as_user
input.description: (Legacy) Pass true to post the message as the authed user. Defaults to true if the chat:write:bot scope is not included. Otherwise, defaults to false.

input.name: icon_emoji
input.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

input.name: icon_url
input.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.

input.name: link_names
input.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

input.name: parse
input.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none. See below.

input.name: thread_ts
input.description: Provide another message's ts value to post this message in a thread. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent's value instead. Ephemeral messages in threads are only shown if there is already an active thread.

input.name: username
input.description: Set your bot's user name.

action.name: chat.postMessage
action.desc: Sends a message to a channel.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See below for more details.

input.name: attachments
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: blocks
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: text
input.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

input.name: as_user
input.description: (Legacy) Pass true to post the message as the authed user instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. Can only be used by classic Slack apps. See authorship below.

input.name: icon_emoji
input.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

input.name: icon_url
input.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.

input.name: link_names
input.description: Find and link user groups. No longer supports linking individual users; use syntax shown in Mentioning Users instead.

input.name: metadata
input.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.

input.name: mrkdwn
input.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.

input.name: parse
input.description: Change how messages are treated. See below.

input.name: reply_broadcast
input.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

input.name: service_team_id
input.description: For a message posted in App Home, Team ID corresponding to the selected app installation.

input.name: thread_ts
input.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

input.name: unfurl_links
input.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

input.name: unfurl_media
input.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

input.name: username
input.description: Set your bot's user name.

action.name: chat.scheduledMessages.list
action.desc: Returns a list of scheduled messages.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: The channel of the scheduled messages

input.name: cursor
input.description: For pagination purposes, this is the cursor value returned from a previous call to chat.scheduledmessages.list indicating where you want to start this call from.

input.name: latest
input.description: A Unix timestamp of the latest value in the time range

input.name: limit
input.description: Maximum number of original entries to return.

input.name: oldest
input.description: A Unix timestamp of the oldest value in the time range

input.name: team_id
input.description: encoded team id to list channels in, required if org token is used

action.name: chat.update

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

input.name: ts
input.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

input.name: attachments
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: blocks
input.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

input.name: text
input.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

input.name: as_user
input.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

input.name: file_ids
input.description: Array of new file ids that will be sent with this message.

input.name: link_names
input.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to none. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, none.

input.name: metadata
input.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. If you don't include this field, the message's previous metadata will be retained. To remove previous metadata, include an empty object for this field. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.

input.name: parse
input.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to client, unlike chat.postMessage. Accepts either none or full. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, client.

input.name: reply_broadcast
input.description: Broadcast an existing thread reply to make it visible to everyone in the channel or conversation.

action.name: conversations.history
action.desc: Fetches a conversation's history of messages and events.

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Conversation ID to fetch history for.

input.name: cursor
input.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

input.name: include_all_metadata
input.description: Return all metadata associated with this message.

input.name: inclusive
input.description: Include messages with oldest or latest timestamps in results. Ignored unless either timestamp is specified.

input.name: latest
input.description: Only messages before this Unix timestamp will be included in results. Default is the current time.

input.name: limit
input.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.

input.name: oldest
input.description: Only messages after this Unix timestamp will be included in results.

query.name: conversations.replies

input.name: token
input.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

input.name: channel
input.description: Conversation ID to fetch thread from.

input.name: ts
input.description: Unique identifier of either a threads parent message or a message in the thread. ts must be the timestamp of an existing message with 0 or more replies. If there are no replies then just the single message referenced by ts will return - it is just an ordinary, unthreaded message.

input.name: cursor
input.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

input.name: include_all_metadata
input.description: Return all metadata associated with this message.

input.name: inclusive
input.description: Include messages with oldest or latest timestamps in results. Ignored unless either timestamp is specified.

input.name: latest
input.description: Only messages before this Unix timestamp will be included in results.

input.name: limit
input.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.

input.name: oldest
input.description: Only messages after this Unix timestamp will be included in results.
